newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cash markets quiet, outright prices turbulent.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cash markets quiet, outright prices turbulent.

text.p: Pre-holiday trading deflated interest in U.S. cash crude business Wednesday, leaving most grades with little price direction against an erratic outright crude performance.
NYMEX futures fluctuated to both sides of the spectrum, posting gains in early action that were later met by technical resistance, prompting heavy selling.

May West Texas Intermediate/Cushing talked late in the session at $20.60-70 a barrel, around 35 cents weaker than late Tuesday's prices. The May/June roll started the day from +4-10 cts, before moving into contango formation late.
